summary: This is an internal FBI email chain regarding the FAA's inadvertent release of Jeffrey Epstein's flight records in response to a FOIA request. The email discusses how the FAA had been withholding the data at the FBI's request due to an ongoing criminal investigation, but the records were accidentally included in a broader data release. The FBI case agent is notified of the situation.

persons.name: Angela Wang
persons.context: A journalist from Business Insider who submitted FOIA requests for Jeffrey Epstein's flight records and later published an article about the FAA's accidental release of those records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The owner/operator of the aircraft (N908JE, N909JE, N212JE, N120JE) whose historical flight data was the subject of FOIA requests and an FBI criminal investigation.

events.title: FOIA Requests for Epstein Flight Data
events.description: Angela Wang from Business Insider submitted two FOIA requests seeking flight records for four Epstein-owned aircraft from 1990 to 2019.

events.title: Publication of Article on Data Release
events.description: Angela Wang published a Business Insider article revealing that the FAA had inadvertently released Jeffrey Epstein's flight records.

events.title: FAA Notification to FBI
events.description: The FAA FOIA Program Manager emailed the FBI to inform them that Epstein's flight data had been inadvertently released in response to a FOIA request for the entire TFMS repository.

keyFacts: The FAA had been withholding all flight data for Jeffrey Epstein's aircraft (N908JE, N909JE, N212JE, N120JE) at the request of the FBI, citing an ongoing criminal investigation (Exemption 7A).
The FAA inadvertently released Epstein's flight records as part of a broader FOIA production for its entire Traffic Flow Management System (TFMS) repository.
Journalist Angela Wang from Business Insider had previously been denied these specific records but later published an article exposing the accidental release.
The FBI case agent for the SOD (Special Operations Division) investigation into Epstein was notified of the data breach by the FBI's FOIA Unit Chief.
The FAA stated it had implemented measures to prevent future releases of Epstein's flight data from the TFMS repository.
